abstract: Italian government, after years of criticism for neglecting Pompeii, comes up with a long-term plan that will preserve the archaeological site and protect it from the growing interference of local organized crime.

byline.original: By ELISABETTA POVOLEDO; Compiled by DAVE ITZKOFF

lead_paragraph: The country has been criticized for neglecting its most famous archaeological area and for allowing the influence of Camorra, the Neapolitan organized crime network, to grow.

headline.main: Italy Unveils Plan to Preserve Sites and Prevent Interference by Organized Crime at Pompeii
